workflow_runs.name: Linux Packages
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

head_commit.message:
VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

* EXTRA: Move Rust-in-XCode logic to rustlang.cmake

* Add Glean to the network extension target

* Initialize Glean on the network extension

* Make iOS tunnel message handling more robust

+ Create a telemetryEnabled message type

* DETOUR: Create singleton to manage iOS tunnel

* Sync telemetry enabled value with iOS Network Extension

* Update Glean to v53.0.0

* Shutdown Glean on tunnel destruction

This is added to the iOs network extension but not the Android
daemon, because the network extension process is immediatelly
killed when the VPN is turned off. If we want to send a ping
on deactivation it doesn't get persisted unless we wait for
the Glean dispatcher.'

* Address location issue

head_commit.message:
Bug 1774273 - Part (1/2) - Add signingscript macos notarization task (#7044)

MacOS notarization is moving from iscript to signingscript and requires a separate task.

There are no ways of testing notarization outside production. So, this change only adds the notarization task, but DOES NOT affect any other tasks.
The current signing still notarizes, and is treated as source/upstream by the beetmover task

Restore qtglean/Cargo.lock (#7026)

Cargo.lock files are required so that a given version of Mozilla VPN
can be rebuilt from the same code.

The NixOS package cannot be built without Cargo.lock, because NixOS
enforces this kind of determinism using a sandbox that disables
network access for builds that don’t have a fixed output hash.

This undoes #6278.  See also #3341, #5236.

Signed-off-by: Anders Kaseorg <andersk@mit.edu>

workflow_runs.display_title: ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

head_commit.message:
ci: remove bogus check for destination_paths in beermover (#6950)

This check neglects to take into account the fact that there are two
products being beetmoved. Addons and the client. E.g, when the
shipping-phase is `promote-addons`, the client tasks will have no
destination paths, and that is totally valid.

workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4585: Add a taskcluster job to build static Qt for Linux (#6611)

head_commit.message:
VPN-4585: Add a taskcluster job to build static Qt for Linux (#6611)

* Add a taskcluster job to build Qt for Linux
* Update the base image to ubuntu:22.04. What could possibly go wrong?
* Use linux-g++ instead, it's more portable
* Disable ICU support, why does it insist on dynamically linking?
* Patch library RPATH when bundling solibs
* Use a fetch task for Qt sources
* Use fetch task for Qt/Mac too
* Try building VPN client with static Qt
* Add libssl-dev to enable OpenSSL support in Qt
* Use a versioned URL for win-rustup fetch task.

workflow_runs.display_title: Fixes for release promotion on the staging repo (#6768)

head_commit.message:
Fixes for release promotion on the staging repo (#6768)

* taskcluster: enable decision task routes/indices on the staging repo

This lets release promotion automatically find the corresponding on-push
decision task for easier testing.

* taskcluster: turn off release-notify on level1

We don't want to bother/confuse the slack channel for staging releases,
and we don't have the required scopes there anyway.

workflow_runs.name: Linux Packages
workflow_runs.display_title: Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph re…

head_commit.message:
Add mozilla-mobile/releng as CODEOWNERS to Taskcluster / Taskgraph related files (#6774)

Releng acts as CODEOWNERS for these files in many other projects as
well. This way we can help nudge projects towards standardized ways of
doing things which brings benefits to everyone!

Note that we typically review for best practices / security, but don't
want to add friction or get involved in the minor details of a CI
pipeline. So in most cases, it would be good to get a review from
someone on the VPN team as well.

workflow_runs.name: Linux Packages
workflow_runs.display_title: Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

head_commit.message:
Fix double leading / in mozillavpn.json path property (#6722)

Paths like //usr/lib/mozillavpn/mozillavpnnp may cause Firefox to not
find the mozillavpnnp binary

Currently uses disagree on whether it is meant to be absolute or relative to /

From linux/mozillavpn.spec:
%cmake -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/usr/lib -DCMAKE_INSTALL_SYSCONFDIR=/etc -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

From linux/debian/rules:
	dh_auto_configure -- -DWEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR=/lib -DBUILD_ID=$(DEB_VERSION) -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF

Use an absolute path be default for WEBEXT_INSTALL_LIBDIR, as it is
easier when variables point to install dirs in build processes, i.e.
/${lib} is easier than stripping a leading / from %{_libdir}.

workflow_runs.display_title: CMake support for iOS - Round Two! (#5076)

head_commit.message:
CMake support for iOS - Round Two! (#5076)

* Initial experiments building for iOS with CMake
* Add Info.plist template
* Build network extension for iOS
* Add Adjust support with -DBUILD_ADJUST_SDK_TOKEN=<token>
* Add some notes to the README.md
* Remove duplicate wireguard-go-version.h
* Fix cmake dependencies for glean
* Use find_program to locate golang build tool.
* Fix ios app entitlements
* XCode: disable auto-generation of build schemes for every target
* Add bundling of .xcasset catalog
* Revisit codesigning for non-Xcode generators.
* Ensure we use a consistent python for config and build
* Fix cross-compilation bugs for golang libraries
* Add workaround for iOS simulator builds on M1/M2 macbooks.
* Fix bug in macos app entitlements
* Split gleansample.h generation to fix Xcode dependency bug.
* Fix dependency loop between vpnglean and mozillavpn targets
* README: Correct capitalization of Xcode
* Fix vpnglean builds for iOS on M1 macs
* vpnglean: Force linking with /usr/bin/cc when building in Xcode
* qmake: Force python3 path for glean at config time
* Update README with instructions for simulation
* Fix missing vpnglean generated directory error
* Revert unnecessary sources.cmake change

Disable glean-prove-scraper action - VPN-3396 (#5071)

workflow_runs.name: Linux Packages
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from oth…

head_commit.message:
VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from other device (#4623)

* Start periodic operations timer whenver a token is available

1. That is all we need to run those operations
2. That ensures the operations are run also when in the device limit
   screen.

* Skip device check when in StateDeviceLimit

* Always enqueue a remove device task regardless if device is in
DeviceModel

TaskRemoveDevice already deals with the possibility of the device
not being registered to the given user. No need to handle
that in multiple places.

Also by not launching task remove device, operations to take
user out of device limit state don't happen and that leaves users
trapped in device limit screen.

workflow_runs.name: Linux Packages
workflow_runs.display_title: Update xcodebuild script to only build for x86_64 arch (#3972)

head_commit.message:
Update xcodebuild script to only build for x86_64 arch (#3972)

With the change from Apple to switch to arm64 on new macbooks
the default value of the ARCHS_STANDARD configuration is 'arm64 x86_64'.

Since the VPN app does not support arm64 architectures yet,
this is an issue (see: https://mozilla-hub.atlassian.net/browse/VPN-82).
It became an apparent issue, though, after the addition of the
signature Rust library to the codebase.

Rust will only build for the active architecture (x86_64), while xcode
will attempt to build for both. That was causing a linker error.
